nodes.long_description:
**Become part of an elite special forces unit in Tactical Assault VR!**

• Habie147 - ‘Tactical Assault Is One Of The Best Hardcore Shooters I’ve Played’

• Gamertag VR - ‘The Best Tactical VR FPS On Quest’

• Controlled Pairs - ‘The Best CQB Game I've Ever Played’

Tactical Assault VR is an intense tactical shooter where you use real-world CQB (Close Quarters Battles) tactics to stack up, breach doors and eliminate threats. Play solo or join an online co-op special forces unit in missions around the world.

# Features
**PvE Missions: Solo or Online Multiplayer Co-Op with Up to 6 Players**
{1487526115258066}

**PvP: Competitive Online Multiplayer**
{1082589306850803}

**7 Non-Linear, Asymmetrical Missions & 2 Wave Shooter Experiences**

Plan your assault. The choice is yours.
{448475627682065}

**Hostile Surrendering**

{999770658801096}

**Game Mode Variety**

Bomb Defusal, Hostage Rescue, High-Value Target (HVT) Eliminations, Mini Games, Room Randomizer Killhouse
{1946208202559962}

**30+ Detailed Weapons and Counting**

Customize your loadout with tactical gear including vests, helmets, weapons, scopes, sights, grips and breaching equipment.
{1007758587705278}
nodes.short_description: Tactical Assault VR is an intense tactical shooter where you use real-world CQB (Close Quarters Battles) tactics to stack up, breach doors and eliminate threats. Play solo or join an online co-op special forces unit in missions around the world.

nodes.long_description:
Become part of an elite special forces unit and use real-world CQB (Close Quarters Battles) tactics to clear rooms, breach doors, and defeat the enemy threat.

FEATURES:

• Utilize an arsenal of weapons, scopes, sight attachments, explosives and equipment.

• Take note of simulated wind and target distance with the wind meter and spotter scope. Calculate physics-based bullet drop and time-to-hit to improve your accuracy.

• Use stealth to sneak up behind enemies with a silent knife kill. Or go head-to-head against enemies that will take cover and attempt to flank your position.

• Randomized Enemy positions and doors, making each play-through an unknown challenge.

• Non-linear maps give players an endless variety in how they choose to infiltrate and complete missions. Enter buildings through doors, climb ladders to reach rooftops, or climb through windows. The choice is yours.

Tactical Assault VR is currently an Early Access release and is updated regularly.
nodes.short_description: Tactical MilSim CQB (Close Quarters Battles) in Virtual Reality

nodes.change_log:
• (PCVR) Updated PCVR Lobbies giving multiple errors due to higher enemy count
• Fixed Sandbox Roaming enemies not initializing
• Fixed (again, but for real this time!) Render Documentary Camera setting 

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.71 Hotfix
• Fixed LMGs having unlimited ammo
• Fixed Shootout Sand enemies multiplying spawn amount. Back to normal spawn amount.
• Reduced liklihood of Shootout Sand enemies getting stuck inside buildings
• Fixed Avatar Ragdolls turning into Reed Richards on Down/Death
• (Quest) Fixed Singleplayer username not showing in Player Listing

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.7
• (PCVR) Player usernames now forced to use Steam Usernames due to username abuse.
• WARNING: Multiplayer Services will cease with all PREVIOUS versions of TAVR. Please UPDATE YOUR GAME if you'd like to continue playing multiplayer! If you are pirating the game and enjoying it, please support the project by purchasing a copy! Multiplayer services aren't free and every purchase helps keep the TAVR community alive!
• Render Documentary Cameras setting now DISABLED by default.
(PCVR) You must ENABLE the Render Documentary Cameras setting if you'd like to continue using Documentary Cameras
• Weapon Calibration Update v0.4: ALL WEAPONS no longer share a universal setting. Every weapon can now be individually calibrated to your preference in the weapon calibration settings. Additional options include selecting the Universal Calibration setting to share all primary calibration settings. Or apply the Universal setting to the Individual calibration as a starting point.
• (PCVR) Add your own custom Voice-Over commands (MP3 file-type ONLY) through your TAVR installed directory > ASSET_BUNDLES > CustomAudioClips folders
• Improved Enemy Spawning optimization. Count of enemies are now predetermined at the start of the mission. (Future Terrorist-Hunt mode coming soon)
• Added: Multiplayer Training Lobbies now have an Aggressive Enemy Spawn limit due to host spamming. Maximum of 8 enemies in the map at any given time. Aggressive enemy spawning will continue if the enemy count is below 8.
• Fixed incorrect Team-Kill assignments
• Fixed HammerFire Death Spectator Camera screen size
• Fixed enemy MAC10 distant audio being too loud
• Fixed hands disabling in incorrect order as loadout is being destroyed on down/death, leaving a tiny window of interaction with utilities
• HARDCORE DIFFICULTY Bomb Defusal Update: Wires must be lit with a flashlight in dark areas to identify wire color
• (PCVR) Added Steamworks check for any username that is blank. A blank username will result in your Steam Name being used
• Added random gameplay tips to loading screen
• Updated: Easier Lockpicking
• Fixed incorrect compass direction on Sever Snake night
• Added Main Menu > Settings > Default Settings confirmation box to avoid accidental resets

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.7
• WARNING: Multiplayer Services will cease with all PREVIOUS versions of TAVR. Please UPDATE YOUR GAME if you'd like to continue playing multiplayer! If you are pirating the game and enjoying it, please support the project by purchasing a copy! Multiplayer services aren't free and every purchase helps to keep the TAVR community alive!

• (PCVR) Player usernames now forced to use Steam Usernames due to username abuse.

• Weapon Calibration Update v0.4: ALL WEAPONS no longer share a universal setting. Every weapon can now be individually calibrated to your preference in the weapon calibration settings. Additional options include selecting the Universal Calibration setting to share all primary calibration settings. Or apply the Universal setting to the Individual calibration as a starting point.

• (PCVR) Add your own custom Voice-Over commands (MP3 file-type ONLY) through your TAVR installed directory > ASSET_BUNDLES > CustomAudioClips folders
• Improved Enemy Spawning optimization. Count of enemies are now predetermined at the start of the mission. (Future Terrorist-Hunt mode coming soon)

• Render Documentary Cameras setting now DISABLED by default.
(PCVR) You must ENABLE the Render Documentary Cameras setting if you'd like to continue using Documentary Cameras
(PCVR) BloomFX disabled by default

• Added: Multiplayer Training Lobbies now have an Aggressive Enemy Spawn limit due to host spamming. Maximum of 8 enemies in the map at any given time. Aggressive enemy spawning will continue if the enemy count is below 8.
• Fixed incorrect Team-Kill assignments
• Fixed HammerFire Death Spectator Camera screen size
• Fixed enemy MAC10 distant audio being too loud
• Fixed hands disabling in incorrect order as loadout is being destroyed on down/death, leaving a tiny window of interaction with utilities
• HARDCORE DIFFICULTY Bomb Defusal Update: Wires must be lit with a flashlight in dark areas to identify wire color
• Added random gameplay tips to loading screen
• Updated: Easier Lockpicking
• Fixed incorrect compass direction on Sever Snake Night
• Added Main Menu > Settings > Default Settings confirmation box to avoid accidental resets

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.6

Enemy Surrendering and Arresting:
• Created various custom enemy animations
• Added additional weapon variety for enemies (AK74SU, UZI, MAC10, G3K) (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added Enemy Ai Makarov Pistol (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added EnemyAi injured state (limping) to enemies if health drops below 30.
• Updated: Improved Enemy Technical Gunner targeting to find the closest player (accuracy still poopy)
• Added Enemy Surrendering and Arresting. This is a Mission Modifier and must be enabled before a mission (OFF by default)
• Added Voice-Over Commands to lower Enemy morale which can increase likelihood of enemy surrendering

Voice-Over Commands/Enemy Surrendering Tips:
Voice-Over commands only work with the Enemy Surrendering modifier ON. Enemies can decide to hold their position and contemplate their next decision.

Voice-Over Commands:
If an enemy is contemplating, holding JOYSTICK-UP will continually shout "Drop Your Weapon!" voice-over commands to the enemy and lower their morale. The lower their morale, the more likely they will surrender. Some enemies are committed to the cause so not all enemies will surrender, unless forced.

Surrendering:
Enemies can also be forced to surrender or have their morale heavily decreased through non-lethal means such as Flashbangs, Beanbag Shotgun or melee hits. It is also possible to knock an enemy out with a Beanbag Shotgun headshot. The enemy can be detained while in the downed-state.

Detaining:
When an enemy surrenders with their hands up, continue shouting commands to have the enemy drop to their knees. Arresting a standing enemy can also be performed but will take more time to secure.

Securing:
Grab a surrendering enemy by their wrists and hold their wrists until the zip ties are automatically placed. After some time, a confirmation by Operations Command will acknowledge the arrest and the enemy will disappear. An "Enemies Secured" point will be added to the team score.

Maps/Missions Updates:
• Updated VOID Map/Layout/Graphics (Redesigned by Canto/Patient8 Games)
• Added Sand Shootout map. Works with Hostage modifier (protect the injured hostage)
• Updated foliage in Breaking Whisper
• Updated/Optimized trees in Hidden Forest
• Moved Trident Lightning intro spawn to middle of road
• Moved multiplayer lobby menu and start position to lobby briefing room
• Added Spawn Zones to Room Randomizers (great for Force On Force training)
• Updated Room Randomizer doors with middle door frame to have full 150 degree swing

New Weapons/Utilities/Models Upgrades/Updates:
• Added MagPalming (by Justin P. Barnett). Only the magazine held with Trigger can be inserted into weapons
• Added Five-Seven Pistol (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added LVAW (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added M110 Sniper Rifle (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added MC51 (HK51-inspired) Battle Rifle (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added Bean Bag Shotgun to Shoulder Utilities (Modeled by Puddle_NL) Decrease morale with non-lethal bean bags. Does 0 damage
• Updated GPNVG (Quad Night Vision Goggles) (Modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Updated 12x NXS reticle (designed by Puddle_NL)
• Added additional magazine slot per ammo pouch. 2 magazines can now fit into 1 pouch
• Added: SMG selection will now spawn 2 magazines per ammo pouch
• Added Double Breaching Shotgun shells on shell holder
• Added Player Suppression effect + Bullet Whiz/Pass Sound FX
• Added buttstock grabbing for sniper rifles when bipod is mounted
• Updated: Buttstock door hits now require 2 hits to unlock doors
• Updated: M40 Sniper Rifle mag bullets increased to 10 count
• Updated: Re-adjusted most offset sight positions to the rear
• Updated: Increased bipod stiffness for improved control/aim
• Updated: Doorknocker, Shooting Door hinges off will no longer shatters doors. Door will break as a single solid piece. Sledgehammer still shatters doors
• Updated: Increased recoil on Battle Rifles
• Fixed: various Romeo 4T red dot misalignments
• Removed: Grip Button Magazine Grab option due to new Mag Palming implementation/conflicts. Magazine grabbing is by default Trigger Button
• Removed: Magazine collisions with other magazines due to new Mag Palming implementation. Magazines can no longer be stacked on top of each other

Avatar Customization:
• Added: Backpacks to Avatar Customization (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added: Night Vision Selection to Avatar Customization (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added: Shemagh Face to Avatar Customization
• Added: Hand Sleeves option (male and female)
• Added: additional Female Avatar Customization
• Updated: Avatar Color Palettes
• Updated: Avatar Arms to only show if Tshirt is selected (prevents arms from clipping through sleeves)

QoL:
• Added: Default Move Speed option to settings menu. You can now default your speed to Auto-Run. Your joysticks will not longer cry in your presence...
• Added: Laser/Flashlight momentary button release option (available in Settings Menu > Controller Prefs)

Audio Updates:
• Added: Intro music to missions + Intro (Operations Command) Voice Over
• Added: New Voice-Overs (Operations command (Jorin), male (LinearCircle) and female (Rachael Carolane) avatar voice-overs)
• Added: additional enemy vocals (by LinearCircle)
• Added: Enemy Death sounds (by LinearCircle)
• Updated: M4 Rifle sounds
• Updated: MCX Rifle sounds

Networking Fixes:
• Fixed: Other Regions (not North America) disconnecting to main menu when exiting to lobby
• Updated/Fixed/Improved PvP: various map loading issues
• Fixed: Kills counting for multiple players after a player is killed. Kills should only count for the first person to kill a player
• Updated: Improved bullet fire position and trajectory sync over network (weapons are still mis-aligned on network avatars). Should make shot groupings more precise on targets over network

Misc Updates/Fixes:
• (PCVR) Added over-the-shoulder 3rd person camera to documentary cameras
• Updated: Sandbox Combat Targets hit impact changed to metal with increased volume
• Updated: bHaptics Feedback
• Updated: Settings Menu with revamped internal code for settings and updated QoL features
• Updated: Default Vest positions
• Updated: Bullet impact FX
• Updated: Grenade Explosion FX
• Raccoon Raccoon Raccoon
• Updated: More randomization with personal death ragdoll
• Updated: (Quest) Disabled Enemy Muzzle Flash Real-Time lighting for optimization
• Fixed: Trident Lightning Start Time border being absent
• Fixed: Mission Failure if the remaining alive player leaves the room while all other players are dead
• Fixed: Hidden Forest bomb placement not showing on map satellite view

• (PCVR) Updated PCVR Lobbies giving multiple errors due to higher enemy count
• Fixed Sandbox Roaming enemies not initializing
• Fixed (again, but for real this time!) Render Documentary Camera setting 

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.71 Hotfix

• Fixed Shootout Sand enemies multiplying spawn amount. Back to normal spawn amount.
• Reduced liklihood of Shootout Sand enemies getting stuck inside buildings
• Fixed Avatar Ragdolls turning into Reed Richards on Down/Death
• (Quest) Fixed Singleplayer username not showing in Player Listing

Enemies can also be forced to surrender or have their morale heavily decreased through non-lethal means such as Flashbangs, Beanbag Shotgun or melee hits. It is also possible to knock an enemy out with a Beanbag Shotgun headshot. The enemy can be detained while in the downed-state.

Detaining:
When an enemy surrenders with their hands up, continue shouting commands to have the enemy drop to their knees. Arresting a standing enemy can also be performed but will take more time to secure.

Securing:
Grab a surrendering enemy by their wrists and hold their wrists until the zip ties are automatically placed. After some time, a confirmation by Operations Command will acknowledge the arrest and the enemy will disappear. An "Enemies Secured" point will be added to the team score.

Maps/Missions Updates:
• Updated VOID Map/Layout/Graphics (Redesigned by Canto/Patient8 Games)
• Added Sand Shootout map. Works with Hostage modifier (protect the injured hostage)
• Updated foliage in Breaking Whisper
• Updated/Optimized trees in Hidden Forest
• Moved Trident Lightning intro spawn to middle of road
• Moved multiplayer lobby menu and start position to lobby briefing room
• Added Spawn Zones to Room Randomizers (great for Force On Force training)
• Updated Room Randomizer doors with middle door frame to have full 150 degree swing

New Weapons/Utilities/Models Upgrades/Updates:
• Added MagPalming (by Justin P. Barnett). Only the magazine held with Trigger can be inserted into weapons
• Added Five-Seven Pistol (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added LVAW (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added M110 Sniper Rifle (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added MC51 (HK51-inspired) Battle Rifle (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added Bean Bag Shotgun to Shoulder Utilities (Modeled by Puddle_NL) Decrease morale with non-lethal bean bags. Does 0 damage
• Updated GPNVG (Quad Night Vision Goggles) (Modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Updated 12x NXS reticle (designed by Puddle_NL)
• Added additional magazine slot per ammo pouch. 2 magazines can now fit into 1 pouch
• Added: SMG selection will now spawn 2 magazines per ammo pouch
• Added Double Breaching Shotgun shells on shell holder
• Added Player Suppression effect + Bullet Whiz/Pass Sound FX
• Added buttstock grabbing for sniper rifles when bipod is mounted
• Updated: Buttstock door hits now require 2 hits to unlock doors
• Updated: M40 Sniper Rifle mag bullets increased to 10 count
• Updated: Re-adjusted most offset sight positions to the rear
• Updated: Increased bipod stiffness for improved control/aim
• Updated: Doorknocker, Shooting Door hinges off will no longer shatters doors. Door will break as a single solid piece. Sledgehammer still shatters doors
• Updated: Increased recoil on Battle Rifles
• Fixed: various Romeo 4T red dot misalignments
• Removed: Grip Button Magazine Grab option due to new Mag Palming implementation/conflicts. Magazine grabbing is by default Trigger Button
• Removed: Magazine collisions with other magazines due to new Mag Palming implementation. Magazines can no longer be stacked on top of each other

Avatar Customization:
• Added: Backpacks to Avatar Customization (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added: Night Vision Selection to Avatar Customization (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added: Shemagh Face to Avatar Customization
• Added: Hand Sleeves option (male and female)
• Added: additional Female Avatar Customization
• Updated: Avatar Color Palettes
• Updated: Avatar Arms to only show if Tshirt is selected (prevents arms from clipping through sleeves)

QoL:
• Added: Default Move Speed option to settings menu. You can now default your speed to Auto-Run. Your joysticks will not longer cry in your presence...
• Added: Laser/Flashlight momentary button release option (available in Settings Menu > Controller Prefs)

Audio Updates:
• Added: Intro music to missions + Intro (Operations Command) Voice Over
• Added: New Voice-Overs (Operations command (Jorin), male (LinearCircle) and female (Rachael Carolane) avatar voice-overs)
• Added: additional enemy vocals (by LinearCircle)
• Added: Enemy Death sounds (by LinearCircle)
• Updated: M4 Rifle sounds
• Updated: MCX Rifle sounds

Networking Fixes:
• Fixed: Other Regions (not North America) disconnecting to main menu when exiting to lobby
• Updated/Fixed/Improved PvP: various map loading issues
• Fixed: Kills counting for multiple players after a player is killed. Kills should only count for the first person to kill a player
• Updated: Improved bullet fire position and trajectory sync over network (weapons are still mis-aligned on network avatars). Should make shot groupings more precise on targets over network

Misc Updates/Fixes:
• (PCVR) Added over-the-shoulder 3rd person camera to documentary cameras
• Updated: Sandbox Combat Targets hit impact changed to metal with increased volume
• Updated: bHaptics Feedback
• Updated: Settings Menu with revamped internal code for settings and updated QoL features
• Updated: Default Vest positions
• Updated: Bullet impact FX
• Updated: Grenade Explosion FX
• Raccoon Raccoon Raccoon
• Updated: More randomization with personal death ragdoll
• Updated: (Quest) Disabled Enemy Muzzle Flash Real-Time lighting for optimization
• Fixed: Trident Lightning Start Time border being absent
• Fixed: Mission Failure if the remaining alive player leaves the room while all other players are dead
• Fixed: Hidden Forest bomb placement not showing on map satellite view

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.7
• WARNING: Multiplayer Services will cease with all PREVIOUS versions of TAVR. Please UPDATE YOUR GAME if you'd like to continue playing multiplayer! If you are pirating the game and enjoying it, please support the project by purchasing a copy! Multiplayer services aren't free and every purchase helps to keep the TAVR community alive!

• (PCVR) Player usernames now forced to use Steam Usernames due to username abuse.

• Weapon Calibration Update v0.4: ALL WEAPONS no longer share a universal setting. Every weapon can now be individually calibrated to your preference in the weapon calibration settings. Additional options include selecting the Universal Calibration setting to share all primary calibration settings. Or apply the Universal setting to the Individual calibration as a starting point.

• (PCVR) Add your own custom Voice-Over commands (MP3 file-type ONLY) through your TAVR installed directory > ASSET_BUNDLES > CustomAudioClips folders
• Improved Enemy Spawning optimization. Count of enemies are now predetermined at the start of the mission. (Future Terrorist-Hunt mode coming soon)

• Render Documentary Cameras setting now DISABLED by default.
(PCVR) You must ENABLE the Render Documentary Cameras setting if you'd like to continue using Documentary Cameras
(PCVR) BloomFX disabled by default

• Added: Multiplayer Training Lobbies now have an Aggressive Enemy Spawn limit due to host spamming. Maximum of 8 enemies in the map at any given time. Aggressive enemy spawning will continue if the enemy count is below 8.
• Fixed incorrect Team-Kill assignments
• Fixed HammerFire Death Spectator Camera screen size
• Fixed enemy MAC10 distant audio being too loud
• Fixed hands disabling in incorrect order as loadout is being destroyed on down/death, leaving a tiny window of interaction with utilities
• HARDCORE DIFFICULTY Bomb Defusal Update: Wires must be lit with a flashlight in dark areas to identify wire color
• Added random gameplay tips to loading screen
• Updated: Easier Lockpicking
• Fixed incorrect compass direction on Sever Snake Night
• Added Main Menu > Settings > Default Settings confirmation box to avoid accidental resets

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Tactical Assault VR v0.8.6

Enemy Surrendering and Arresting:
• Created various custom enemy animations
• Added additional weapon variety for enemies (AK74SU, UZI, MAC10, G3K) (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added Enemy Ai Makarov Pistol (modeled by Puddle_NL)
• Added EnemyAi injured state (limping) to enemies if health drops below 30.
• Updated: Improved Enemy Technical Gunner targeting to find the closest player (accuracy still poopy)
• Added Enemy Surrendering and Arresting. This is a Mission Modifier and must be enabled before a mission (OFF by default)
• Added Voice-Over Commands to lower Enemy morale which can increase likelihood of enemy surrendering

Voice-Over Commands/Enemy Surrendering Tips:
Voice-Over commands only work with the Enemy Surrendering modifier ON. Enemies can decide to hold their position and contemplate their next decision.

Voice-Over Commands:
If an enemy is contemplating, holding JOYSTICK-UP will continually shout "Drop Your Weapon!" voice-over commands to the enemy and lower their morale. The lower their morale, the more likely they will surrender. Some enemies are committed to the cause so not all enemies will surrender, unless forced.

Surrendering:
Enemies can also be forced to surrender or have their morale heavily decreased through non-lethal means such as Flashbangs, Beanbag Shotgun or melee hits. It is also possible to knock an enemy out with a Beanbag Shotgun headshot. The enemy can be detained while in the downed-state.

Detaining:
When an enemy surrenders with their hands up, continue shouting commands to have the enemy drop to their knees. Arresting a standing enemy can also be performed but will take more time to secure.

Securing:
Grab a surrendering enemy by their wrists and hold their wrists until the zip ties are automatically placed. After some time, a confirmation by Operations Command will acknowledge the arrest and the enemy will disappear. An "Enemies Secured" point will be added to the team score.
